ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A better understanding of practical R-code and how working for clients would be.
How to approach and concisely answer questions though data science projects

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Brian is an amazing professor, and this class is a must-take!

This course was amazing!! My favorite statistics class I have taken so far. Brian is great and super understanding and helpful. The size of  course was also one of it's greatest strengths and made me feel like the mini-projects were approachable and the learning was collaborative. I thought that by having a different mini project every 10 days I was able to gain skills for doing stat projects across so many different fields.

Strength: the class environment and vibe is great thanks to Prof. Macdonald and the small class size; the project assignments are interesting; the final individual capstone project takes up some time but the overall workload is very reasonable

Strengths: Very understanding and reasonable professor who made class fun; taught like a senior capstone class. Weekly/Bi-weekly projects were fantastic because we were doing something different every week. The breadth of data science done in the class was also very helpful for graduating seniors

Weaknesses: Knowing the specific skills/data techniques we would encounter in the class at the beginning of the semester

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: MUST TAKE FOR stats majors!!!! I took this on top of the senior project 492 course and I am so happy I did! The format and size was great and I never had to stress about the course. I had fun doing the projects, the class was super engaging and Brian is awesome!!

Yes, absolutely! Not even considering that this is a required course if you're not completing a stats thesis, this is still one of the best classes I've taken at Yale. Prof. Macdonald is so easy to approach and helpful, and the projects we've worked on in the class are actually interesting and good to learn from. I feel like I filled in the holes for the things I thought I'd learn from stats major but didn't before.

Yes. Keep in mind, the class was very small this semester so professor help was more personal and the class became very close. If you are choosing to do a thesis or this class, this class would be a great capstone and summarization of S&DS at Yale. It might be less of an intellectual challenge than a thesis though.
